condition.description: Many children wet the bed until they are 5 or even older. A child's bladder might be too small. Or the amount of urine produced overnight can be more than the bladder can hold. Some children sleep too deeply or take longer to learn bladder control. Children should not be punished for wetting the bed. They don't do it on purpose, and most outgrow it. Until then, bed-wetting alarms, bladder training and medicines might help.
condition.name: Bedwetting

carousel_items: Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

clock.tip: Works faster on an empty stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic (water pill). It works in the kidneys to make you urinate more, which removes extra water and certain electrolytes. This lowers blood pressure and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrochlorothiazide is a well-tolerated water pill that's often the first-choice treatment for mild high blood pressure.
downsides: Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

upsides: Works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people. Works especially well for African Americans.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Good option if you have both high blood pressure and heart failure.
Raises calcium levels in the body, so it can be good for people with osteoporosis to slow down bone loss and even help with new bone formation.
Most people have very few side effects.

upsides_processed.orig: Works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.

Good option if you have both high blood pressure and heart failure.
Raises calcium levels in the body, so it can be good for people with osteoporosis to slow down bone loss and even help with new bone formation.
Most people have very few side effects.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure. Removes extra water from your body.

userStories.tip: I sometimes have pain in urethra

userStories.tip: take it early in the day or closer to when you can go to the bathroom.  long distance traveling and not near a bathroom can be a hassle if you wait.
take it in the morning, restrict afternoon caffeine

drugs.name: Hydrochlorothiazide

carousel_items_processed.orig: Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Hydrochlorothiazide. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Hydrochlorothiazide. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Hydrochlorothiazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

description_processed.orig: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Hydrochlorothiazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

risks_warnings.title: Gout
risks_warnings.description: Hydrochlorothiazide can increase uric acid levels and cause or worsen gout. Uric acid levels may need to be monitored if you have gout.

description_processed.orig: Hydrochlorothiazide can increase uric acid levels and cause or worsen gout. Uric acid levels may need to be monitored if you have gout.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Vision changes can happen weeks to months of using Hydrochlorothiazide. Tell your doctor immediately about any vision changes or worsening.

description_processed.orig: Vision changes can happen weeks to months of using Hydrochlorothiazide. Tell your doctor immediately about any vision changes or worsening.

carousel_items: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). It helps improve your mood by altering the levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and other similar chemicals in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Nortriptyline is a good option for treating depression, especially for people who also have problems with persistent nerve pain.
downsides: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

upsides: Helpful with treating certain types of pain, like migraines or nerve-related pain.
Generally well tolerated and has fewer side effects than other medicines in the same class of drugs.

upsides_processed.orig: Helpful with treating certain types of pain, like migraines or nerve-related pain.
Generally well tolerated and has fewer side effects than other medicines in the same class of drugs.

userStories.tip: It gives me crazy dry mouth, but it's totally worth it--SSRIs don't work for me. Nortriptyline does. It's been a godsend for my depression.
Take it at night around 7 and on 30mg but so far its working better than the Lyrica did

drugs.name: Pamelor

carousel_items_processed.orig: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Nortriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 10.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Nortriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 10.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. Be careful since you can feel dizzy or fall. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. Be careful since you can feel dizzy or fall. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline has a moderate risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Nortriptyline has a moderate risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

carousel_items: It can cause changes in sex drive.
Can raise your blood pressure and pulse, so it's not safe for people with heart problems.
It can also cause changes in your mood.
Take it at the same time every day.
Common side effects include decreased appetite, nausea, and constipation.
The capsules can't be opened and need to be swallowed whole.

basics.benefits_moa: Strattera is a norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (non-stimulant). Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD, but it increases norepinephrine activity in the brain, which affects attention and behavior.
basics.bottom_line: Strattera isn't considered a first-line medication for ADHD, but since it isn't a stimulant, it's still highly recommended.
downsides: It's a second-line medication used to treat ADHD. Other medications are usually tried first.
It's only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: It's a second-line medication used to treat ADHD. Other medications are usually tried first.
It's only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.

upsides: One of the few medications used to treat ADHD that's not a stimulant.
Strattera is used in combination with counseling or other non-drug therapies to treat ADHD.
You usually only need to take it once a day.

upsides_processed.orig: One of the few medications used to treat ADHD that's not a stimulant.
Strattera is used in combination with counseling or other non-drug therapies to treat ADHD.
You usually only need to take it once a day.

drugs.one_liner: Helps you focus and stay alert.

userStories.tip: Take it in the morning, make sure you have a meal. Don't forget it.
Taking it at bedtime reduces chance of nausea, although it lasts a little later into the evening if you take it when you first wake up. Pick your poison.
Take it with 'heavy' food with a lot of fat and protein to avoid nausea

drugs.name: Strattera

carousel_items_processed.orig: It can cause changes in sex drive.
Can raise your blood pressure and pulse, so it's not safe for people with heart problems.
It can also cause changes in your mood.
Take it at the same time every day.
Common side effects include decreased appetite, nausea, and constipation.
The capsules can't be opened and need to be swallowed whole.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thinking
risks_warnings.description: Children and adolescents on Strattera may be at higher risk to attempt suicide. If you notice worsening changes in your child's behavior or wants to hurt himself or herself, talk to your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Children and adolescents on Strattera may be at higher risk to attempt suicide. If you notice worsening changes in your child's behavior or wants to hurt himself or herself, talk to your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Liver disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Strattera who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare and usually goes away after stopping the medication. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Strattera who have suffered liver damage sometimes to the point of liver transplant. This has been rare and usually goes away after stopping the medication. If you notice yellowing of the eyes or skin, dark urine, or abdominal pain, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Serious or life-threatening cardiovascular events
risks_warnings.description: Strattera has been associated with heart attack, stroke, and sudden death. Anyone with a history of heart problems shouldn't take it, and people should be screened for heart problems before starting it. Watch out for unexplained fainting or chest pain that comes on with physical activity.

description_processed.orig: Strattera has been associated with heart attack, stroke, and sudden death. Anyone with a history of heart problems shouldn't take it, and people should be screened for heart problems before starting it. Watch out for unexplained fainting or chest pain that comes on with physical activity.

risks_warnings.title: Aggressive behavior and psychosis
risks_warnings.description: Taking a stimulant like Strattera may worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

description_processed.orig: Taking a stimulant like Strattera may worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

risks_warnings.title: Prolonged erection
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of men having an erection lasting more than 4 hours while on Strattera. This has been rare. If not treated in time, this can cause permanent damage to your penis, including impotence. Talk to your doctor immediately or go to the emergency room if this happens.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of men having an erection lasting more than 4 hours while on Strattera. This has been rare. If not treated in time, this can cause permanent damage to your penis, including impotence. Talk to your doctor immediately or go to the emergency room if this happens.

risks_warnings.title: Problems with urination
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people having problems with urination while on Strattera. This has been rare. If you notice a feeling of incomplete emptying of your bladder while urinating, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people having problems with urination while on Strattera. This has been rare. If you notice a feeling of incomplete emptying of your bladder while urinating, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Long-term growth suppression
risks_warnings.description: Appetite suppression may occur. In clinical studies, long-term treatment with stimulants similar to Strattera caused a temporary slowing of growth rate (both height and weight) in children who started the medication before they started puberty. Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Appetite suppression may occur. In clinical studies, long-term treatment with stimulants similar to Strattera caused a temporary slowing of growth rate (both height and weight) in children who started the medication before they started puberty. Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.
